titleStmt.title: Adam Lundtze et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG7361

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: To His Excellency Thos E Bramlett Govenor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky we the undersignd Citizens of the County of Boyd most respectfully state that our fellow citizens Kohn & Miller were fined one Hundred and Twenty dollars at the last ^October^ term of the Boyd Circuit Court, Said Kohn & Miller were merchants and had licens to sell by the quart The whisky was sold with no intention to evade the law or to violate the same The whisky was not drank on the primises we ask your Excellency to remitt said sfine agst said Kohn & Miller who are good Citizens of the Commonewealth of Kentucky

Adam Lundtze
Joseph Gilkey
William. Daum.
E Mountain
W, H, C, Brown
Martin Riley
John Chap
H A Poage
G G. B Myers
J. D. Jones
Seimon Lemonn
J. Maig.
John Donby.
William Johnson
Georg
Samuel Jackson
G W locey
M. Davis
Wm T Katzel
L T Moore
G. May
W D Cronely
Wilhelm Keil
S. E. Veyssie
Jacob Price
Joseph P Rankin
George Birgraf

Boyd Cir Ct
vs
Kohn & Miller
$120.
Tipling
Remitted 10th Nov/65
